Description:
Company:Job Area:General Summary:Job Summary:This position reports to the Global IT Operations center lead of Qualcomm and will be responsible for IT Service Management & Analytics for Global OneIT Team.Responsible for providing technical support and guidance in a complex IT environment. You will be required to have expertise in ServiceNow and ITIL processes, as well as the ability to corelate data, identify trends and patterns, create & manage data visualizations to provide insights, customer, and stakeholder management. You will be part of OneIT team which is responsible for maximizing business value by delivering differentiated IT solutions and services for Qualcomm’s dynamic business with an innovative and inclusive workforce.Principal Duties and Responsibilities:Lead the ITSM activities and tools configurations for Qualcomm Device Cloud (QDC) offerings from ITOC perspective.
Establish effective communication channel with both External and internal stakeholders for addressing QDC related activities.
Provide technical support to IT Teams for ServiceNow and other ITSM tools, including troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.
Closely working with Tools and Monitoring team and focusing on event correlation and anomaly detection, providing, and maintaining valuable insights in real time through creative data visualization dashboards
Engage with stakeholders (both internal and external) on various operations support requirements within ITOC.
Actively participate in handling major outages (Major Incident Management Process).
Contribute aggressively to various IT Governance boards.
Participate in the development and maintenance of ITIL processes, policies, and procedures.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT operations, service desk, and development teams, to identify and resolve issues.
Provide guidance to team members on ITIL processes, Project Management and ServiceNow best practices.
Monitor ServiceNow and other ITSM tools to ensure compliance with established service level agreements (SLAs).
Identify opportunities for automation, continuous improvement and implement the solutions.
Develop and maintain documentation of ITIL processes and ServiceNow workflows.
Provides insight and supports the evolution of applications, systems, and/or processes to a desired future state by maintaining a comprehensive understanding of how current processes impact business operations across multiple domains.Collaborates with other teams to develop solutions for complex systems and processes within assigned business domain(s) by interfacing with stakeholders and appropriate IT teams.
Develop, train, coach and mentor members of the team and provides development assignments.
 Preferred Experience & Qualifications:15+ years of IT-related work experience with a bachelor’s degree in computer science/IT Engineering or equivalent.Strong Experience in IT service management with expertise in ITIL processes.
Experience in Project Management tools such as MS Projects, Boardwalk, Tempus etc.
Experience with ServiceNow or other ITSM tools, including configuration and customization.
Strong knowledge in ITSM Analytics and Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, ServiceNow, QlikView
Knowledge of IT Infrastructure, including servers, networks, and applications.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large teams.
Experience in fixing, analyzing logs, building metrics and operational dashboards.
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Good knowledge of programming language such as Python, Go, API integration.
Certified in ITIL4 Expert, PMP/Prince2 and SAFe Agilist/Scrum Master.Level of Responsibility: 
•    Working independently with little supervision.
•    Providing guidance to junior members of the team.Person should have a strong focus towards continual service improvement and focus towards improving efficiency by striving for automating standard tasks and applying lean principles.
Serving as liaison between technical and non-technical teams, in internal organizations as well as in client and vendor/subcontractor organizations, to ensure all project targets and requirements are met.
Strong analytical/problem solving skills, ability to provide alternatives, root cause analysis, testing skills and ability to make thoughtful proposals are also among the skills required.
Manage shift schedules and provide ongoing feedback as part of the Infrastructure Management team.
Strong understanding of ITIL and project management standards 
Stakeholder Management
Analyses and reviews Service Performance against the SLAs and OLAs.
Displays extensive working knowledge of industry standards and practices, including technical details and company services offered.Minimum Qualifications:Applicants: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email toaccommodationsupportQualcomm expects its employees to abide by all applicable policies and procedures, including but not limited to security and other requirements regarding protection of Company confidential information and other confidential and/or proprietary information, to the extent those requirements are permissible under applicable law.To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies:Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.Job Details
